page.title: 04Sleap Airfield Farm
page.content: Sleap Airfield Farm is owned by Mr. Bromley and has only 20 acres on a central site with some more acres being away from these. The animals kept are beef cattle, cows and calves. The farm grows grass for silage and hay, and some oil seed rape. A compound fetilizer is used to improve the soil, as is animal manure. The present farmer has one part-time helper and gets up at 7 o'clock, retiring to bed at about 11 o'clock.The farm buildings are about one hundred years old although the present owner has only lived there for 14 years. Cattle are sold at Shrewsbury market but are not taken to shows.The farmer most enjoys feeding the stock.
